_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 12:03:40 using v2.1
title: Did people feel they were treated with respect and dignity?
analysis_commentary: The proportion of people who felt they had been treated with dignity and respect is the most positive result of the questions included here; 94% of people from 2010 to 2013 felt they were 'definitely' or 'to some extent' treated with dignity and respect. The proportion who felt they had definitely been treated with dignity and respect has decreased by 2% from 2010 to 2013. The proportion fell by a further 11% from 2013 to 2014, but note that the question posed in the survey was changed to refer to the organisation providing care, as opposed to the health or social care professional.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
